problem.p: Assume we are trying to calculate the sum of all numbers starting from 0 to any number we want. Which of the following recursive functions successfully implements this task?

div.p: The second choice will always return 0, since we are not calculating the sum, but instead just giving a new input to the function. For example, if our input is 3, this is what our calls would look like:
-> 3 is not 0, call function with input 3-1 = 2
-> 2 is not 0, call function with input 2-1 = 1
-> 1 is not 0, call function with input 1-1 = 0
